field.note: The Sage Pay Direct Protocol (2.23 is the version when this payment gateway is created).
The Vendor Login Name is supplied by Sage Pay when your account is created. It is used to authenticate your site.
How long to wait for a response, in seconds, before returning an error. Defaults to 60 seconds if unspecified.
The currency used in all the e-commerce transactions.
The free text description of goods or services being purchased. It is displayed in the My Sage Page screens of the vendor account for reference.
The flag to indicate if delivery address is billing address. If the answer is yes, the card holder will not need to supply delivery address.
The flag to indicate if delivery address is hidden. If the answer is yes, the delivery address will get values from the pass-through variables.
The Card Types that are supported by this Payment Gateway. The selected card types will be available in the drop-down box of %card_type% keyword replacement.
The flag to enable 3-D Secure check for the transactions. If 3-D Secure is ON for the vendor account, this flag must be yes.
The flag to enable AVS/CV2 check for the transactions. If AVS/CV2 is ON for the vendor account, this flag must be yes.

The name of the pass through variable for Gift Aid. If the pass through value is 1, yes or true string, this payment will be a Gift Aid charitable donation and the customer has AGREED to donate the tax. This feature is only of use if your merchant account is Gift Aid enabled.
The name of the pass through variable for First Name.
The name of the pass through variable for Surname.
The prefix of the pass through variables for the first address component. For example, the variable names of Address 1 are address1_1 and address1_2, this value will be address1_
The prefix of the pass through variables for the second address component. For example, the variable names of Address 2 are address2_1 and address2_2, this value will be address2_
The name of the pass through variable for City.
The name of the pass through variable for Postcode.
The name of the pass through variable for Country.
